name: Fort Qaitbey
description: Resembling an imposing castle fortress, this citadel was built in the 1480s by Sultan Qaitbey on the site of the Pharos Lighthouse, to protect the city from the crusaders who used to attack the city by sea.

name: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa
description: An ancient circular staircase leads down into these tombs that were tunneled into the bedrock during the age of the Antonine emporers (2nd century AD).

name: Bibliotheca Alexandrina
description: Located near the site of the ancient library of Alexandria, this modern version is an eleven-story, cylindrical-shaped building that houses more than eight million books. A re-imagining of Alexandria's ancient Great Library, this gorgeously designed cultural center contains a host of museums as well as one of the modern world's most ambitious libraries. Its architecture - a giant sun disk - presides over the waterfront Corniche, while inside, a huge reading room can hold eight million volumes. Below themain library, visitors can explore a range of beautifully curated exhibitions. TheManuscript Museum with its magnificent collection of ancient texts and scrolls and the Antiquities Museum with its Graeco-Roman antiquities and statuary found during underwater exploration in the harbor are the two prime attractions. But there are also rotating art exhibitions, a permanent Egyptian folk art collection, and a Science Museum and Planetarium that are aimed squarely at children.

name: Alexandria National Museum
description: More than 1800 archaeological pieces are exhibited chronologically from one floor to the next: the basement is devoted to Prehistoric and Pharonic times; first floor to the Graeco-Roman period; second floor to the Coptic and Islamic era that highlights artifacts raised during recent underwater excavations.

name: Snorkeling at Sharm El Sheikh
description: Enjoy this once in a lifetime experience that has you discovering the exotic underwater world of the Red Sea. Board your coach at the pier for the short drive to Sharks Bay where your motorboat awaits at Hyatt Regency resort. Once you have boarded, you'll set off on a northern course toward an area of the Bay known for its wonderful snorkeling opportunities.Arriving at one of the premier snorkeling areas, you can either relax on board the boat or enter the warm, crystalline waters where you can swim and snorkel amongst the colorful fish and beautiful coral formations. A qualified instructor accompanies you during your excursion to provide assistance and offer information about the region's marine life as well as direct the boat to the best snorkeling spots. Bottled water and soft drinks are available on board for your refreshment.After approximately 2 hours enjoying the enchanting marine environment of the Red Sea, you'll head back to Sharks Bay where you'll be transferred back to the ship.

name: Cairo Opera House
description: This cultural venue, The National Cultural Centre "Cairo Opera House" is part of the Ministry of Culture and serves as an umbrella organization for all the music or dance companies, galleries, museums and the educational programs of the Cairo Opera House. It was established in 1988 with the inauguration of the new Cairo Opera House. Its goal is to promote the arts of music and dance and to preserve and renew traditional Arab music. In order to be more than just a place where music and art are performed the National Cultural Centre wants to give space to learning and inspiration, to the exchange of ideas, the respect of a common cultural heritage, and a shared passion for the arts. It encourages interest for music and art in the younger generation by offering ballet, voice or instrumental classes for talented children or youths. Performances of ballet, operatic or symphonic works are staged with Egyptian companies or in cooperation with foreign ensembles or soloists. Seminars and cultural conferences covering a wide range of artistic and intellectual issues are held regularly. Opera House companies are frequently sent on tours to different Egyptian governorates to give the people in urban areas the chance to see national and international art performances. In March 1985, Former President Mubarak laid the first corner stone of the new Cairo Opera House which was to be built with the support of JICA, the Japan International Cooperation Agency. Careful planning by the Ministry of Culture in Cairo and the JICA produced a design suggestive of traditional Islamic architecture and blending in harmoniously with the surrounding buildings. In October 1988,Former President Mubarak and His Highness, Prince Tomohito of Mikasa, the younger brother of the Japanese Emperor, inaugurated the National Cultural Centre “Cairo Opera House” in a remarkable ceremony. It was the first time for Japan to stage a Kabuki show, a traditional popular drama with singing and dancing, in Africa or the Arab World.

name: The Bedouin Way - Day Tours
description: Enjoy true Bedouin hospitality You'll have a wonderful, relaxed evening under the stars at a quiet mountain location close to Dahab, South Sinai. Held every Saturday, delicious, slow cooked meat is our speciality, especially fresh goat, cooked under the ground until it almost falls off the bone. We also offer beef and chicken, and vegetarians are catered for. Watch Bedouin bread being made, and drink sweet tea or bring your own alcohol. If you have any burning questions about Bedouin life, Mondi and Sofian will be happy to sit and chat with you. There's no rush - we'll pick you up at 5.30pm and take you back when everyone's ready to leave, usually around 10pm. If you would like to eat your dinner in an alternative location or go on one of our desert safaris we'd be happy to speak to you about your requirements. We look forward to providing you with a traditional Bedouin dinner and a memorable evening! Cost per person (including transport there and back): Goat: 250 EGP or €30 Beef: 200 EGP or €25 Chicken: 150 EGP or €20 Vegetarian: 100 EGP €15 Sleeping overnight and traditional breakfast in the morning: 100 EGP or €15 extra (bring your own tent or sleep under the stars on our mattresses). Prices include your choice of meat, vegetables, rice, salad, Bedouin bread, and tahina. The food is plentiful!

description: Premier Rock Climbing in the South Sinai’s Dahab, Egypt, the diving mecca of the Red Sea. We provide expert knowledge, instruction and state of the art climbing equipment. Safety equipment use and safe rope practices are the core of our operation. We offer a variety of climbing: Sport, Traditional (Trad), Bottom/Top roping, and Bouldering, as well as beginner and advanced courses, guided day trips locally. We run Try Climb days for novices to get a taste of what climbing is about. We also offer climbing safaris to St. Katherine for full day, multi-pitch climbing. When you want a break from the spectacular waters of Egypt’s Red Sea, contact us and we will take you to new heights, “Above Sea Level.”

name: Sinai Bedouin Safari
description:
Welcome to Sinai (Egypt)! 
--------------------------
"Sinai Bedouin Safari" is delighted to welcome you to the blessed and beautiful land of the Sinai peninsula. We invite you to discover the treasures of true deserts, surrounded by the stunningly azure-blue Red sea. The blue color of our special sea is caused by the combination of iron in our sands with salt in the sea. 

About Sinai:
-----------------
Sinai is located between the Gulf of Aqaba, the Suez canal and the Mediterranean Sea. The Sinai peninsula is approximately 380 kilometers long between the North and South coasts and 220 kilometers from West to East. There are 22 different Bedouin tribes living here. They are natives to this land for centuries.

About Dahab:
-------------------
Dahab is located on the Red Sea between Sharm-el-Sheikh to the South and Nuweiba to the North. Dahab is one of the most attractive beach resorts in South Sinai, Egypt. Its sea shore is covered with fine golden sand that might have given Dahab its Arabic name, "Gold".
Dahab is a real paradise for diving and snorkeling thanks to amazing underwater landscapes of the Red Sea. Dahab is also a well-known spot for kite- and windsurfing because it is located in the wind tunnel of the Gulf of Aqaba. 

Please feel welcome to join us in Sinai on a desert safari. 'Sinai Bedouin safari' offers trekking and camel trips around the scenic desert, 4x4 jeep safari, backpacking, the unique experience of a Bedouin dinner in the mountains, and rock climbing, to name a few of our activities- all led under the watchful eye. Of our expert and trustworthy guides. You are most welcome to discover secret Bedouin pathways with us.

Enjoy the miracles of the Red Sea by scuba diving, snorkeling, and boat trips.

Relish the water-and-wind delights with wind surfing and kite surfing. 'Sinai Bedouin Safari' can arrange your Accommodation and transportation to and from any airport or hotel in Egypt.

The duration of our trips is ranging from 1 to 12 days, so you can choose the most suitable kind of trip or safari for your holidays.

Just e-mail us and we will take care of the rest.

Hurghada Museum is not only the first antiquities museum in al‑Bahr al‑Ahmar (Red Sea) Governorate, but also the first museum that is the result of a joint project between the Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities, al‑Bahr al‑Ahmar (Red Sea) Governorate, and the private sector. name: Dive Point Red Sea
description: When you want more than just a holiday, come to Dive Point Red Sea. The choice is yours. We are convinced we have every opportunity to give you the holiday you want and deserve. Make your next trip, your best ever! 1992 saw the establishment of the location where thousands have learned to dive or taken the life changing step towards becoming a diving professional, and where hundreds return regularly to enjoy the highest quality of service and the attention of dedicated staff, Dive Point Red Sea. Wherever you are staying in Hurghada and Sahl Hasheesh, we can offer our services to you with FREE transfers from all the hotels. Transfers from the Makadi Bay area are available as well for a nominal daily charge. No matter if you would like to go for daily dive or snorkelling trips onboard our own spacious boats, to one of the more than 60 fabulous snorkel & dive sites around Hurghada, or want to become a diver or a diving instructor or would like to explore the deeper areas with Trimix & CCRs - we offer it all! The complete range of PADI (Recreational and Technical Diving), DAN, IART, IANTD, TDI & RAID courses is available from introductory levels up to Instructor qualifications. Our dedicated and service oriented staff team is the most experienced in the training of PADI Professionals in the Red Sea, consisting of 3 PADI Course Directors and 6 IDC Staff and Master Instructors working fulltime in the field of Instructor training. One example of our continuously developing customer service is the large investment we made in a Nitrox membrane system. The safety of our guests is our major priority and for this reason all Nitrox certified divers, receive SINCE 2001 Nitrox 32 FOR FREE in our dive centers! As a TDI training facility offering also PADI, IART, IANTD & RAID training up to Advanced Trimix Diver we are in the same time THE experts for rebreather diving in Hurghada! Ambient Pressure Inspiration & Evolution, JJ-CCR, Hollis Explorer & Prism2, Poseidon Se7en & ISC Megalodon Rebreathers are available in our rental department including spare parts & service facilities. We have an extensive stock of technical diving rental equipment, a gas filling station with Helium and Oxygen fills up to 250 bar, everything you could possibly want. Top quality storage and cleaning facilities for guest equipment are right in the diving centre as well as toilets and fresh water showers. A complete workshop with trained technicians offers the chance of equipment fixing and servicing. The setup is completed by a full dive store, which offers diving equipment for sale and in the middle of the centre is the "50 BAR Safety Stop" Tiki Bar for the time in between or after dives. All facilities have been planned and constructed by us! As PADI 5 Star Career Development Centers and 5 Star IDC Centers respectively we are able to offer a large variety of services and activities for divers, future divers and non-divers alike. Our goal every day is to provide you with an unforgettable holiday. Its time you chose Dive Point Red Sea!
